deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2094-03-19
GSH Internal Medicine Admit Note
Patient's name: Faulkner, Yandel
MRN: 507-55-61
Date of Admission: 3/18/94
ATTG: Yazzie
CONTACT: Carlos Faulkner (son) 441-626-7981; 278-032-7163
ID/CC: 69 yo M with complicated medical history presents from rehab with likely aspiration event. Most of the data herein is from the medical record.
HPI: Patient is a 66 yo M with a complicated medical history. Recent medical events summarized below:
1/22/94: presented to Vanderbilt University Hospital on 1/22/94, notable for the following:
- hyperosmolar nonketotic hyperglycemia (BS>1400)
- LLE was noted to be cool and ischemic, CPKs > 1300
1/24/94: transferred to DCGH for revascularization. Hospital course notable for the following:
- ruled in for MI with peak Tn=0.96
- LLE thrombectomy
- Right to left femoral PTFE graft
- Discovery of possible embolization from the left endograft limb
- Development of postoperative compartment syndrome, requiring fasciotomies of all 4 compartments
- HIT positivity
- DM management by Dr. Phelps
- Extubation postoperatively, with reintubation POD #3 2/2 inability to protect airway
- Aspiration events, PNA
- Sepsis, requiring pressors MRSA
- Septic emboli in L lung
- Pneumonia Pseudomonas, Klebsiella
- Difficult vent weaning
- Tracheostomy placement, eventual decanulation
- Failure of multiple swallowing trials
- G-tube placement
- Renal failure, improved when decreased diuresis
- Conjunctivitis, bacterial endophthalmitis
- Wound Care for chronic LLE wounds
- Likely graft infection with the decision to treat with Rifampin and Bactrim for 2 months
3/15/94: transferred to KH
- multiple episodes of TF emesis, cough, gagging, O2 sat 80% RA rx'd with sxn, O2, Zofran
- 3/18/94 patient developed severe hypoxia O2 sat 70% RA. ABG on 50% TM: 46/43/7.47, oximetry 90%
3/18/94: DCGH ED
- SaO2=90% on 100% NRB, rx'd with vanco, clinda, NS, combivent
ROS: +cougn, no CP/SOB, no abdominal pain, no nausea, no fever/chills
PMHx: (as above, also)
1. Hypertension.
2. Hyperlipidemia.
3. Peripheral vascular disease
4. Cataracts.
5. Status post cerebrovascular accident
6. peptic ulcer disease status post a bleeding duodenal ulcer
7. status post left carotid endarterectomy in January 2091.
8. DM
9. PVD
10. chronic LLE wounds
11. renal failure
Medications on Transfer:
NPH 12 U Q12H
Tube Feeds osmolite @ 95 (stopped)
Nystatin S/spit
Atrovent/Albuterol Nebs
Asa 81
Lopressor 50 Q6H
Erythromycin Ophthalmologic Ointment DS Q12H
Lasix 40 BID
Colace 100 TID
Zaroxyln 5 QD
Coumadin
Regland 10 BID
Protonix 40 QD
Epo 10,000 U TIW
Rifampin 600 QD
Bactrim DS BID
Zofran
Silvidine
Bacitracin
Allergies: heparin HIT
FHx: noncontributory
SHx: Patient lives in Old River. He has a 100 pack-year smoking hx. He quit drinking EtOH 30 years ago.
Physical Exam:
VS: BP=90/50; HR=94; RR=20; SaO2=90-94% 4L; T=98
General: uncomfortable, chronically ill-appearing, speech breathy
HEENT: NC/AT, PERRL, EOMI, sclera anicteric, MM dry, tongue cracked
Neck: plethoric, JVP @ 8 cm, trach site well-healed
Chest: coarse rhonchi throughout, scattered wheezes
Cor: faint HS, regular S1/S2, no murmurs
Abdomen: soft, NT/ND, no masses
Ext: bilateral clubbing; LLE with multiple shallow ulcers, toes black
Neuro: sleepy, arouses easily to voice, follows commands

Radiology:
DCGH Chest, 1 view 18-Mar-2094 15:59 Accession# 3624881 Final
Findings suspicious for early right lower lobe pneumonia.
Possibly related to aspiration. Clinical correlation and possibly
further imaging as described is advised.
EKG: sinus, long QT, TWI in V1, TW flattening V2 (old)
Assessment/Plan: 69 yo M with recent extended hospitalization for HONC, ischemic LLE, recurrent aspiration, presents with aspiration event at rehab.
Aspiration PNA:
- rx for aspiration PNA: Vanco (MRSA), Clinda (anaerobes), Amikacin (Pseudomonas and
Klebsiella, based on prior resistance patterns)
- ID consult in AM (need ID approval for Amikacin)
- Supplemental O2
- Nebs prn
- Chest PT
- Incentive spirometry
- NPO/NPGT (except meds) for now
FEN:
- gentle hydration, D5 NS
- hold diuretics at present
- hold TFs at present
- speech/swallow consult
Vascular:
- consult Madison County's service
- wound care with silvadine/bacitracin
- wound care consult
- continue Rifampin/Bactrim for ?graft infxn
- coumadin for goal INR=2-3
DM:
- management per Dr. Phelps
- QID FS
- Insulin SS coverage
Renal Failure: Baseline BUN/Cre = 52/2.1; now 82/3.8
- hx embolic events concerning for ?cholesterol emboli, ?septic emboli send urine eos, complement
- check urine sediment
- urine lytes, urine urea, urine osms
- hold diuretics for ?prerenal component to renal failure
- consider evaluation for renal artery stenosis
Anemia: Patient's baseline Hct on d/c= 29; remains at baseline
- recheck Fe studies
- guaiac stools
Ophtho: continue erythromycin ophtho ointment
Gen Care:
- PT/OT
- Access: R PICC line (read on CXR as subclavian - too far?)
- Proph: Nexium, coumadin
- Precautions: MRSA, aspiration
Ursula Isabella-Venegas, MD
#25112
